字幕内容: Xie An: Please.
Qi Yan: Please.
Qi Yan: Please evaluate this
Xie An: The hounds are killed for food once the hares are bagged
the bow is cast aside once there are no birds left to hunt?
Aiyo
Qi Yan: I will trouble brother Yuanshan to bring this calligraphy back with you
and give it to brother ‘Shuhan’.
Xie An: Aiya
I know that His Highness not volunteering himself
for the disaster clean-up as you advised
disappointed you
but His Highness regrets it as well.
There are many things holding him back
he has asked me to bring a gift of apology to you in his place.
Worthy brother
Our Highness is still young after all.
He did not understand at the time
字幕颜色: thinking it to be a difficult chore.

字幕内容: It was only when the Second Prince volunteered
seizing the opportunity that he had a realization!
He already regrets it
oh how he regrets not listening to your advice!
Qi Yan: Hah
字幕颜色: the Third Highness must have as many aides in his estate as there are clouds in the sky.

字幕内容: He no longer has eyes for a counselor in common clothes like me.
What a waste of my loyalty.
How dangerous is this path?
One wrong step is all it takes!
Xie An: Yes
How is worthy brother the wearer of common clothes
worthy brother is the imperially chosen Flower Seeker
virtuous and talented.
Worthy brother…
You understand this as well.
There is no coming back from what we are striving to achieve.
If we succeed
we will be ministers of merit for the new court.
If we fail
it’s over for us!
Worthy brother
Qi Yan: Forget it.
A scholar will give his life for those who understand him.
Tell me
Xie An: Who knows if that rotten log of the Second Highness
found some talent who gave him this fine idea or not
but he is very likely to get back on his feet this time.
Ever since he went to the north of Luo
he has been working actively in disaster aid
putting the Qing and Yi provinces in good order
and he has even sold the valuables accumulated in his estate
and exchanged a year of his fiefs
to copper coins and supplies
distributing them to the families of victims
and the impacted folks in nearby provinces.
Apparently…
Nangong Wei also dug burial pits with the soldiers himself.
He wrote a memorial of ten thousand words for the common folks
who lost their lives in the conflict
and ordered a craftsman to engrave it on stone.
On the day of burial
in the name of His Majesty
he offered three animal sacrifices
and gave a bow of courtesy.
Xie An: Every single one of these deeds reached the capital city quickly
as if they’ve grown wings.
Be it the world of commoners or the court
the Second Highness’ reputation has reached extreme heights.
Worthy brother…
Please think of something quickly!
Qi Yan: So there is a skilled person behind the Second Highness offering advice
these are great plans.
Xie An: Worthy brother
this is a serious matter
you have to think of something quickly.
Qi Yan: Brother Yuanshan
but I’d like to know exactly
how much authority the Third Highness has given you
and how much trust?
What I am about to say
could be the difference between success and failure
can you handle it?
Xie An: Rest assured
His Highness does not suspect his subordinates
and he would not employ those he suspects.
I
column5: have already bound my life and all that I have to His Highness.

字幕内容: His Highness is truly having a hard time at the present
otherwise he would have come to see you in person.
Qi Yan: In that case
I have a poem and a message for His Highness.
I’ll trouble brother Yuanshan to take the brush and write this poem down.
Xie An: Alright
Qi Yan: A pair of suns hung in the sky
the east dims as the west glows.
A day will come where the sun enters the jade treasure
spreading its mighty name far
Qi Yan: Ask His Highness to send this poem to the northern nine provinces with haste
turn it into a catchy tune.
Teach it to the children first
and let it find its way to the capital city.
Xie An: Worthy brother is truly a schemer like no other!
And the message you’d like to give is…?
Qi Yan: Please tell the Third Highness…
Xie An: The Third Highness is neither legitimate nor the eldest
and his mother’s family is not as stable as the Second Highness and Fourth Highness either.
On the path to snatch the crown…
the Third Highness has an innate disadvantage.
One who will achieve great things are not bound by minor details!
Nangong Wang: Is that all Qi Yan had to say?
Nothing else?
Xie An: Yes.
Other than that insinuating poem
that is all Qi Yan had to say.
Nangong Wang: That Qi Yan
he is most certainly qualified to be my top aide
but his schemes and tactics are too sinister.
He did not even blink while offering the plan to burn the Weiming palace.
His temperament truly makes me uneasy
but…
His insight into the greater picture and people’s minds is indispensable aid to me.
Xie An: Master
the Second Highness has a skilled person behind him giving him pointers.
If you wish to succeed
you can’t do it without Qi Yan.
Although his tactics are sinister
he only seeks to become an important official.
He has no royal blood or a great family background.
Once Your Highness ascends to the throne
doesn’t his life and death still depend on your word?
Is there truly a need to be so worried
He is a scholar after all
he has nothing but pride in his bones.
A little courtesy given
and he will gladly endure any hardships.
Nangong Wang: Mn…
You are right.
Emperor Father has been careful for most of his life.
The less unrelated two people may seem
and the less connected two matters may be
as long as one of them is the biggest beneficiary
Emperor Father will certainly catch it…
How brilliant of Qi Yan!
Xie An!
Xie An: This humble one is here.
Nangong Wang: Go and prepare…
Do as Qi Yan says.
Xie An: Understood!

sincerity

what I sowed

the diverging path
before my eyes
I
can't hate

My heart
ground to dust
There is no room for regret in a path towards a dead end

no hesitation
